intro: Strophanthus bariba, commonly known as the red spider flower, is a striking tropical plant native to regions of Africa. It is characterized by its long, pendulous clusters of bright red flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap and showy blooms. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and glossy, while its stems are often woody and branched. Strophanthus bariba is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil.
